life.name: Conway's Game of Life
life.desc: A fast (active cell list based) simulation of Conway's Game of Life. A "Glider Gun" generates gliders which eventually wrap around because of the torus topology.

chess.name: Chess Game
chess.desc: Has computer vs player & computer vs computer modes. There are two difficulty settings for the AI (default is fast but poor moves). Features a randomised opening book with 2188 variations. Does not detect checkmate or any end of game.

space_invaders_demo.name: Space Invaders
space_invaders_demo.desc: A space-invaders style game. Use the ← left and right → arrow keys to move the cannon. Press the ↑ up arrow key to fire. This game currently has no victory condition or shields for the player.

small_font.name: Smaller Font
small_font.desc: A comparison between a small 4px font and the standard library's 8px font.

kernel.name: Cooperative Multitasking Kernel
kernel.desc: A simple kernel allows 16 programs to run concurrently. Each program simply displays an increasing counter alongside its PID. All LEDs in out#3 are lit when in kernel mode, visualising the time spent in the kernel.

snake_demo.name: Snake Game
snake_demo.desc: A snake game implemented with circular buffers. Use the arrow keys to steer the snake.

3d_renderer.name: 3D Renderer
3d_renderer.desc: A triangle-based 3D renderer. Renders a 28-frame animation of an F-117 aircraft into memory and then plays it on a loop.

ping_pong.name: Ping Pong
ping_pong.desc: A classic ping pong game. Player 1 uses keys A & D to move the paddle. Player 2 uses keys J & L to move the paddle. Optionally, one or both of the players can be computer controlled. Select the game mode by pressing number 1, 2 or 3 on the title screen.

type_test.name: Text Editor Prototype
type_test.desc: Type text with your keyboard and watch it appear on screen. Press enter to start a new line and use backspace to remove characters as usual. Note: does not yet support the shift or caps-lock keys.

shape_test.name: Shape Drawing Test
shape_test.desc: A continually-looping test of the square and circle drawing functions from the standard library. There are no controls for this demo.

kerning_test.name: Character Drawing Test
kerning_test.desc: A demonstration of the aesthetic advantages of drawing characters with proper spacing (kerning) over fixed spacing (monospace). However, the time consuming nature of this method can be seen by watching how fast the monospace rendering is by comparison.

standard_library.name: Visualize the Standard Library
standard_library.desc: A simple program that imports the entire standard library and then draws the contents of the ROM to the display (VRAM).

life_slow.name: (Slow) Conway's Game of Life
life_slow.desc: A simple implementation of Game of Life for reference.

int_tests.name: Integer Tests
int_tests.desc: Runs a series of sanity checks on the four different integer data types to check they behave as expected.
